oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Curly Putman Interview by John Lomax III
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is an interview of Curly Putman by John Lomax III. The interview takes place on 10-26-1981.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Curly Putman;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:00) -- Introduction by John Lomax - interview conducted at the offices of Tree Publishing Company. (0:14) -- Curly Putman mentions that he worked in the Navy as a 'plane spotter'. He spent four years on the U.S.S. Valley Forge in the Korean War. (0:47) -- John Lomax asks Curly Putman about his songwriting method and inspiration. (1:41) -- John Lomax asks Curly Putman about his songwriting schedule. "Usually I try to be thinking about it [songwriting] everyday" - Curly Putman. (2:24) -- John Lomax asks about the original inspiration for the song "Green, Green Grass Of Home." Curly Putman mentions that he wrote the song about a character in the movie "The Asphalt Jungle." (4:02) -- Curly Putman says that you could interpret "Green, Green Grass Of Home" as a dream. (4:32) -- John Lomax asks about the song "My Elusive Dreams." (5:56) -- Curly Putman mentions that he lived in Alabama when he received his first BMI Award. Curly Putman went to work for Tree Publishing Company in 1964. (8:21) -- Curly Putman mentions Bobby Bare taking interest in "Green, Green Grass Of Home." (8:54) -- John Lomax asks Curly Putman how he deals with the loneliness of songwriting. (10:51) -- John Lomax asks Curly Putman about his pre-writing process (in the car). Curly Putman mentions carpooling with Sonny Throckmorton. (12:58) -- Curly Putman discusses writing music along with current songwriting trends. (13:42) -- Curly Putman speaks about his own company, "Green Grass Music" which was in conjunction with Tree Publishing Company. Putman came back to Tree Publishing Company in 1972. Curly Putman mentions that trying to be a business executive hurt his personal songwriting. (14:44) -- John Lomax asks Curly Putman about co-writing.
